Edward Anderson (February 1, 1820 â€“ December 11, 1896) was a state legislator in Texas during the Reconstruction era. He served in the Texas House of Representatives for District 14 in 1873. Anderson was unseated later that year after testimony from fellow legislators.
A former slave, he was documented as a farmer.
